Sentence.sentence: That relative strength would be consistent with what was seen in the wider retail industry during the early part of the holiday season.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: One relative bright spot for Macy's during the holiday season was the online channel, where it rang up double-digit increases in sales and a 25% increase in the number of orders it filled.

Sentence.sentence: 2% in November and December at stores open more than a year, a disappointing holiday season performance that capped a difficult year for a department store chain facing wideranging challenges.

Sentence.sentence: Good morning! America’s holiday shopping season starts on Black Friday, the day after Thanksgiving.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Each burning season in the Amazon, fires deliberately set by frontier settlers and developers hurl up almost half a billion metric tons of carbon a year, placing Brazil among the top five contributors to greenhouse gases in the world.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The average amount of time students now take to complete an undergraduate degree has stretched to six years and seven months as students interrupted by work, inconvenienced by unavailable classes, or lured by one more football season find it hard to graduate.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The last generation of the season about the forth may make the journey back in Mexico and restart the cycle.

Sentence.sentence: When I say I live in Sweden, people always want to know about the seasons.

Sentence.sentence: A season in the field will help determine which, if any, of the varieties are ready for commercialization.

Sentence.sentence: As each summer season approaches, there's no escape from it.

Sentence.sentence: He said although more fishing was taking place nearer penguin colonies it was often happening later in the season when these colonies were empty.

Sentence.sentence: It is the season for some frantic last-minute math一across the country, employees of all stripes are counting backward in an attempt to figure out just how much paid time-off they have left in their reserves.

word_mean: 一年内气候有明显差异的几个不同阶段。一般划分为春、夏、秋、冬四季。在四季不明显的地区, 则划分成二季或三季, 如干季、雨季、凉季等。

sentences.en: The seasons change, independent of anyone's wishes.

means.word_mean: 时期; 活动期, 季

sentences.en: When does the basketball season end?
sentences.cn: 篮球赛季什么时候结束?

means.word_mean: （热带地区的）旱／雨季；（一年中开展某项活动的）季节，旺季 ；（一部戏剧在一地的）演出期，上演期；（一系列的戏剧、电影或电视节目的）会演，荟萃 ；（一年中时装、发型等的）流行期

sentences.en: The soldiers were not yet seasoned to the rigorous climate.
sentences.cn: 士兵们尚未能适应此种严寒的气候。

sentences.en: He likes to eat mutton which was seasoned with garlic.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢吃用大蒜调味的羊肉。

sentences.en: Timber seasons quickly in the wind.
sentences.cn: 木材在风里干得很快。

sentences.en: The carpenter taught us how to season wood.
sentences.cn: 这位木匠教我们怎样对木材进行干燥处理。</seg>

jx.jx_en_mean: suitable in or appropriate for every kind of weather
used as an expression of goodwill at Christmas or the New Year
jx.jx_cn_mean: 致以节日的问候（圣诞或新年时的问候语）

jx.jx_en_mean: Available or ready for eating or other use.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 当令的：现成的或准备食用或其它用途的

jx.jx_en_mean: Legally permitted to be caught or hunted during a specified period.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 猎捕期的：法律上允许在某一持定时期内可进行猎捕的
及时的：在合适时间的；碰巧的

jx.jx_en_mean: Not available, permitted, or ready to be eaten, caught, or hunted.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不当令的：不现成的、不被允许的或尚不能吃、抓或猎捕的

jx.jx_en_mean: Not at the right or proper moment; inopportunely.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不合时宜的：不在合适的或正确的时间的；不凑巧的

entry.def: The seasons are the main periods into which a year can be divided and which each have their own typical weather conditions.

example.tran: 秋天是我最喜欢的季节。

example.ex: ...the only region of Brazil where all four seasons are clearly defined.
example.tran: 巴西唯一一个四季分明的地区

entry.def: You can use season to refer to the period during each year when a particular activity or event takes place. For example, the planting season is the period when a particular plant or crop is planted.
entry.tran: (一年中某项活动或某一事件发生的)节期，时期

example.tran: 飞来准备度过繁殖季节的鸟群

example.ex: For law students, autumn brings the recruiting season.
example.tran: 对学法律的学生来说，秋季是招聘旺季。

entry.def: You can use season to refer to the period when a particular fruit, vegetable, or other food is ready for eating and is widely available.
entry.tran: (水果、蔬菜等的)当令期，上市期

example.ex: The plum season is about to begin...
Now British asparagus is in season.

entry.def: You can use season to refer to a fixed period during each year when a particular sport is played.

example.ex: It is his first race this season.
example.tran: 这是他本赛季的第一场比赛。

entry.def: A season is a period in which a play or show, or a series of plays or shows, is performed in one place.
entry.tran: (戏剧、表演的)上演期，会演期，献演期

example.tran: 皇家芭蕾舞团的夏季献演期

entry.def: A season of films is several of them shown as a series because they are connected in some way.

example.ex: ...a brief season of films in which Artaud appeared.
example.tran: 阿尔托出演的系列影片的短暂上映期

entry.def: The holiday or vacation season is the time when most people have their holiday.

example.ex: There are discos and clubs but these are often closed out of season.
example.tran: 那里有迪斯科舞厅和夜总会，但是通常只在度假旺季营业。

entry.def: If you season food with salt, pepper, or spices, you add them to it in order to improve its flavour.

example.ex: Season the meat with salt and pepper...
example.tran: 用盐和胡椒粉给肉调味。

example.ex: I believe in seasoning food before putting it on the table.
example.tran: 我认为在把食物端上餐桌前应该先调味。

entry.def: If wood is seasoned, it is made suitable for making into furniture or for burning, usually by being allowed to dry out gradually.
entry.tran: 对(木材)作干燥处理;风干，晒干(木材)

example.ex: Ensure that new wood has been seasoned.

entry.def: If a female animal is in season, she is in a state where she is ready to have sex.

means.word_mean: 1. a period of the year marked by special events or activities in some field;

sentences.sentence: "he celebrated his 10th season with the ballet company"
"she always looked forward to the avocado season"

means.word_mean: 2. one of the natural periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices or atmospheric conditions;
3. a recurrent time marked by major holidays;

sentences.sentence: "Season the chicken breast after roasting it"
"This trip will season even the hardiest traveller"

means.word_mean: 3. make more temperate, acceptable, or suitable by adding something else; moderate;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French seson, from Latin satio(n-) 'sowing', later 'time of sowing', from the root of serere 'to sow'

Sentence.sentence: Where are you in the cycle of renewal: Are you actively preserving the present, or selectively forgetting the past, or boldly creating the future? What advice would Leah give you to move you ahead on your journey? Once we're on the path of growth, we can continually move through the seasons of transformation and renewal.
